event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LEARN
event.text: At various opportunities you will be given the option to check your storage and do various actions onboard your ship. This can happen in situations such as visiting stores, revisiting an explored beacon, or choosing not to interact with an event. It may look overwhelming at first, but eventually you'll become accustomed to the system. To learn about internal upgrades or the onboard lab, visit the database entries under their respective tabs.

Here you may talk to any crew types you have aboard your ship. Most crew have their own unique sets of dialogue, which provide bits of lore, humor, and sometimes hints for various secrets. You can also scan crew which will provide full details of their stats and other characteristics. Some crew, particularly elites, also have special interactions like upgrading certain systems for cheaper.

Here you may view accomplishments throughout the run and lore entries related to them. The mission report tracks bosses defeated, Renegades encountered, loot items found, and unique crew recruited. The mission report provides no practical benefit but can provide insight on just what you've done along your journey!

You may also choose to engage in various tasks. By default, you'll be able to run salvage missions and repair your hull, but if you find a minelauncher weapon you can also lay a trap for the fleet before sector 8. Salvage missions have many different outcomes, some good and some bad, but can turn up valuable loot. Repairing the hull may be less efficient than at a store, but it can get you out of a tight spot.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_INSTALL
event.text: The onboard lab can be used to install upgrades for your crew at empty beacons. You can install the lab for free with a level 2 Medbay, otherwise you must use additional resources.

choice.text: [Federation Database] Learn about the onboard lab.
(Upg. Medbay) Install the lab for free.

event.text: You install the lab.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_UPGRADE
event.text: Upgrading the lab will allow you to access secondary upgrades for crew, which apply buffs to specific subtypes of crew. With level 3 Medbay, you can install the upgrade for free.

choice.text: (Adv. Medbay) Install the upgrade for free.

event.text: You install the upgrade.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_LEARN
event.text: The onboard lab, once installed, allows you to install modifications for species and specific crew types. You must have at least one crew of that species to be able to install modifications for it. Unless specified otherwise, all modifications apply retroactively and to crew gained after the modification was installed. Lab modifications come in two forms, primary and secondary.

Primary modifications apply to all crew of a specific species. However, you can only have one primary modification installed per species, and cannot uninstall modifications. Each species has exactly 3 options for primary upgrades, all of which are available as long as you have the lab installed and at least one crew of that species.

choice.text: Learn about the lab upgrade and secondary modifications.

event.text: Once you've installed the lab you may upgrade it once more to unlock secondary modifications. Unlike primary mods, secondary mods only apply to specific crew types. No crew type has more than one secondary mod, and you may install multiple secondaries under the same species. You do not need a crew member of that subtype to install a secondary for it.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB
event.text: Please select a species you want to upgrade or view currently installed modifications for.

choice.text: [Federation Database] Learn about the onboard lab.
You have upgraded the lab to level 2.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_HUMAN
event.text: You are viewing the lab menu for: [HUMANS]

choice.text: Currently Installed: Diversification. [+12% buff to movement speed, combat damage, repair speed, and health]
Currently Installed: Teamwork Neurons. [+15% stacking buff to combat damage and repair speed for each other human in the room]
Currently Installed: Natural Intuition. [New human crew start at level 2 skills.]
Pri: Diversification. [An upgrade is already installed]
Pri: Teamwork Neurons. [An upgrade is already installed]
Pri: Natural Intuition. [An upgrade is already installed]
Sec [Med]: Hippocratic Oath. [An upgrade is already installed] [Medics do not attack but grant 95% hazard resistance to nearby allied crew.]
Sec [Eng]: Field Training. [An upgrade is already installed] [Engineers repair at default speed but heal crew drones at 6hp/s and buff repair/combat by 15%.]

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_HUMAN_DIVERSIFICATION
event.text:
You are about to install the Diversification modification. [Effects: +12% buff to movement speed, combat damage, repair speed, and health.]
[Warning: After installing this, you will not be able to install any more primary upgrades for Human crew. You will not be able to deactivate this mod either.]
You install the modification.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_HUMAN_TEAMWORK
event.text:
You are about to install the Teamwork Neurons modification. [Effects: Humans gain a stacking 15% buff to combat damage and repair speed while in the same room as other allied Humans.]
[Warning: After installing this, you will not be able to install any more primary upgrades for Human crew. You will not be able to deactivate this mod either.]
You install the modification.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_HUMAN_INTUITION
event.text:
You are about to perform the Natural Intuition modification. [Effects: New human crew will always have level 2 in all skills.]
[Warning: After installing this, you will not be able to install any more primary upgrades for Human crew. You will not be able to deactivate this mod either.]
You install the modification.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_MEDIC_OATH
event.text:
You are about to install the Hippocratic Oath modification. [Effects: Your medics lose the ability to fight but gives a protective aura to allied crew (including themselves) in the same room that grants them 95% resistance to hazards.]
[Warning: This will affect Medic Crew only. You will be able to install other secondary mods and primary mods afterwards.]
You install the modification.

choice.text: You must have the lab upgrade for this modification.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_ENGINEER_DRONES
event.text:
You are about to install the Field Training modification. [Effects: Your engineers lose their repair bonus but heal your crew drones at 5hp/s and buff their combat damage and repair speed by 15%.]
[Warning: This will affect Engineer Crew only. You will be able to install other secondary mods and primary mods afterwards.]
You install the modification.

choice.text: You must have the lab upgrade for this modification.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_ENGI
event.text: You are viewing the lab menu for: [ENGI]

choice.text: Currently Installed: Combat Systems. [Engi crew gain standard combat damage and 10 health, but lose 25% of their repair speed.]

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_INVENTORY_UPGRADES
event.text: You are currently viewing all installed internal upgrades.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_INVENTORY_LAB
event.text: You are currently viewing all installed internal upgrades.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM_LEARN
event.text: Internal Upgrades carry many different passive functions similar to augments, but can be installed at any storage check and do not fill augment slots. Internal augments do not always cost just scrap. As you purchase more systems (or fill other requirements) more options will appear. Some internal upgrades may be mutually exclusive with other upgrades. You can select an internal augment to preview a description of its function before purchasing it.

While somewhat rare outside of starting configurations for certain ships, you may sometimes find special augments marked with an [X]. These augments will provide their function normally as an augment, but can be converted to the internal version for free under the purchase menu. External augments do not count towards mutually exclusive upgrades or upgrade limits. However, once you exchange them for their internal version they will, so be careful! Converting an external augment to internal cannot be undone.

choice.text: Learn about arms and modular [M] variants.

event.text: Under the internal upgrade menu you can also install and uninstall arms. Each arm has a different effect, but you can only have one at a time. Uninstalling arms gives back half of the price to install it. Similar to external augments, you can find Modular Arms marked by an [M] on rare occasions. Modular arms do not count towards the arm limit but take an augment slot. However, Modular Arms cannot be internalized. The arm menu is located under "Onboard Tech".

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM_MEDBAY
event.text: What upgrade do you want to install?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM_MEDBAY_LEVEL4
event.text: You are about to upgrade the Medbay to level 4. [Effects: Rapid Healing, is not compatible with medbots]
You install the upgrade.

choice.text: This upgrade is unavailable. Is not compatible with medbots.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM_MEDBAY_NANO
event.text: You are about to install Med-bot Dispersal. [Effects: While Medbay is powered, crew will heal anywhere on the ship at 25% speed of your current Medbay level.]
You install the upgrade.

choice.text: This upgrade is unavailable. Is not compatible with Medbay lvl 4.

event.text: You install the upgrade.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM_MEDBAY_SPEED
event.text: You are about to install Medical Stimulants. [Effects: While Medbay is powered, crew gain an extra 25% movement speed for each powered level of Medbay]
You install the upgrade.
You install the upgrade.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM_MEDBAY_RESISTANCE
event.text: You are about to install Safety Blankets. [Effects: Your crew are immune to fires and suffocation damage while in the Medbay.]
You install the upgrade.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM_CLONEBAY
event.text: What upgrade do you want to install?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM_CLONEBAY_LEVEL4
event.text: You are about to upgrade the Clone Bay to level 4. [Effects: Instant Cloning, Heals crew to full every jump. Is not compatible with DNA Banks.]
You install the upgrade.

choice.text: This upgrade is unavailable. Is not compatible with Backup DNA.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM_CLONEBAY_DNA
event.text: You are about to install Backup DNA Banks. [Effects: Your crew is safe in clone storage even if the system is off, hacked, or broken.]
You install the upgrade.

choice.text: This upgrade is unavailable. You need a level 2 Clone Bay.
This upgrade is unavailable. Is not compatible with a Level 4 Clone Bay.

event.text: You install the upgrade.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CLONE_CANNON
event.text: What do you want to do?

choice.text: Upload a new crew to the cannon.

event.text: Who do you want to put in the cannon? [You will be given extra confirmation after each option]
Are you sure? There are so many corpses, this won't remove the augment either.
You start the process.
You finish the process.
Are you sure? There doesn't seem to be much practical benefit to putting the bird in the cannon.
Never one to be told when you've gone too far, you plug the bird into the cannon.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_GATLING
event.text: You begin the construction process. The first part is the Base.
You place the Gatling Base on the fabrication table. Next you will need the Barrel.
You lock the Barrel in place. All that's left is the Pre-Igniter tech.
You install the Pre-Igniter, and luckily the weapon seems to accept it despite being damaged.
You install the Pre-Igniter, and luckily the weapon seems to accept it despite being from a modern era.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_GATLING_NAME
event.text: As you step back to admire the weapon, only the most important step remains. This weapon needs a name!

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_AUG_ANCIENT_ACTIVATOR
event.text: Are you sure you want to do this?

choice.text: Awaken the alien using the activator and some fuel. [-5{]

event.text: You activate the key and slide it into the Ancient. The robotic being stirs to life, as 4 cubes raise off the ground and begin to orbit around it. Its singular eye, if you could call it that, lights up and immediately begins to scan the surrounding area.

event.text: Are you sure you want to do this?

choice.text: Scrap part of the plating. [5 hull damage, +30~]

event.text: You tear off a sizeable chunk of the hull and bring it aboard.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_AUG_PANDORA
event.text: Are you sure you want to do this? [50% chance for an amazing reward, 50% chance for a horrible outcome, will remove the augment]

choice.text: Open the box and await what's inside.

event.text: You press a switch on the back of the box, and a hissing noise escapes as the walls of the box expand outwards...

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_AUG_PANDORA_ANCIENT
event.text: Are you sure you want to do this? [50% chance for an amazing reward, 50% chance for a horrible outcome, will remove the augment]

choice.text: Open the box and await what's inside.

event.text: You press a switch on the back of the box, and a hissing noise escapes as the walls of the box expand outwards...

A brilliant light fills the ship, and you feel a great joy overtake you. Everything feels like bliss, like everything will be ok. When you snap out of your trance, you find the ship has been remarkably better stocked than it was before.

A dark gloom consumes the ship, overwhelming your senses with the sounds of screams and the scent of rotting flesh. When the gloom has gone away, the ship is in horrible disrepair, and you are haunted by a feeling of regret.

removeCrew.text: Your crew does not appear in the Clone Bay, and it seems their records have been wiped completely. Whatever has happened to them cannot be undone.

The beacon beeps and a cascading signal richochets outwards into the depths of space. You don't know who's listening or where they are, but hopefully they're friendly. Or carry good loot.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LURE
event.text: Are you sure you want to do this? [Boosts the fleet 1 jump, locates a Rebel Elite]

You mask your identification as Rebel and search for nearby Elites. Though the fleet will likely be able to track this back to you eventually, you now know the location of the nearest Elite ship to kill.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_LURE_ELITE
event.text: You've tracked down the Rebel Elite. The ship seems confused that you've found them, but neither of you are about to pass up a fight!

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_FAIL
event.text: Ellie growls at you as you approach, clutching her knife firmly in one hand. You stop before getting too close, realizing she must be furious you failed to clear off her precious list. You make a brief apology and head off before she can do anything drastic.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_BUSY
event.text: Ellie stares at you blankly when you approach and says nothing. You try to talk to her but she stops you. "Captain, why are you here? Don't you have... THINGS to be doing? Did you forget your promise? Go. Get. Them. Done. Pleeeeasssse?" Ellie smiles innocently.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_1
event.text: You find Ellie giggling to herself in the corner. As you approach, she perks up. "Oh superfan, I have a requeeeeeesssst of you!" Ellie pulls out a long list and hands it to you. "This is my super-duper revenge list! It's all the people who I want to put. In. The. Ground. For taking the Ellie show off-air! Deranged lunatics, Rebel supporters, probably fascist psychomurderer bad guys! You already promised me you'd help." Ellie clasps her hands together and bats her fake eyelashes uncomfortably close to your face. "So, when do we get started?"

event.name: ELLIE_1_START
event.text: Ellie smiles and points to the first name on the list. "Rigley Spruce, head of merchandising for Flower and Sunshine Studios! He was the first weak link... they cut all of my merchandise before they gave me the boot, because they thought the children would forget about me! Who could forget their FAVORITE childhood character? I'm the best character in all of media history! I'm fabulous to my very core! Rigley's a fat, alcoholic, piece of little rotten... uhm... woops, that's not very PG. He's a bad guy, okay? He was part of Vance's little riot group back before the Civil War too! We're going to start with him..."

choice.text: Have you considered not murdering these people?

event.text: Ellie blinks and laughs. "Hahah. No."
"Soooo... are you going to help?"

choice.text: I'm not comfortable doing this right now.
I'm not comfortable doing this right now.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_2
event.text: You find Ellie sorting through some merchandise she stole from the warehouse. You don't remember her doing that but you don't bother asking. When she finally notices you watching her, she looks up and smiles the same menacing smile once again. "Ready for another, superfan? We did super fantasticalicious last time, and I can't WAIT to get another off my list!" She makes a horse noise and pretends to prance around.

event.name: ELLIE_2_START
event.text: Ellie pulls out her list again, which you notice now to have been hastily scribbled on the back of a receipt. "Hum, let's see! OH, of course! Old Hueghey Armstrong! Chief legal consultant for Flower and Sunshine Studios. He was always so boooooorrrrring! Yap yap yap, all he did was talk about mumbo jumbo legal stuff. Children aren't entertained by LAW! They're entertained by ELLIE THE EQUINOID! But of course, you know that superfan! He was also on... uhm... I think he did some stuff for Vance? Bah he's probably a human supremacist! Ellie doesn't like human supremacists. Ellie loves all creatures equally! So long as they understand that Ellie belongs on the air! For the people to see! Well... what are you waiting for? Let's go!"

choice.text: Was cutting off Rigley's hand necessary?

event.text: "Yes." Ellie doesn't hesitate for a moment.

choice.text: What was that paper you grabbed from his desk?

event.text: "Doesn't matter. Stop procrastinating superfan, and just say you're going to help me!" Ellie frowns.

choice.text: I'm not comfortable doing this right now.
I'm not comfortable doing this right now.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_3
event.text: You find Ellie staring at a pack of stolen cigarettes in her hand, pondering them deeply. When she notices you, she stashes them in her suit and spins around in a circle. "Another day, another entry on the liiiiiissssst to cross off! Yippee! I am super duper franticalasticly excited for the next one!"

event.name: ELLIE_3_START
event.text: "We're going after my old ex-friend Remmy the Rekma! He plays poker with some friends at a local establishment, and we're going to crash his littttlllle PAAARTY! Hahah! He was always so funny with his goofy accent and those big ears of his, too bad he didn't have my back when I was sacked! I saw that little traitorous neerdowell shaking hands with Sammy and welcoming him onto the cast the week before I got the pink slip! And traitors deserve a little payback, don't you think?"

choice.text: Was burning down that office necessary?

event.text: "Of course it was silly! Hueghey did all sorts of evil things! He was practically a supervillain. But he's just too boring to be one."

choice.text: Other people worked at that firm though.

event.text: "And so what? If they were working with Hueghey they deserved it! Bad actions are infectious, you need... you need... stop distracting me! Let's get a move on!" Ellie wavers, as if struggling to defend her actions.

choice.text: I'm not comfortable doing this right now.
I'm not comfortable doing this right now.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_4
event.text: Ellie is whistling the theme song to her own show in perfect rhythm whilst snapping her fingers and bouncing back and forth. "We're almost at the end of the list, superfan! I am soooo excited! EEEEEH! Are you ready?! Like, super duper ready?!"

event.name: ELLIE_4_START
event.text: "Next up is the one and only Paul Lancastor, director of the Ellie the Equinoid show! Well, about to be FORMER director, hahah! The decision to fire me was as much his fault as it was Vance's, and I have a special treat for him!"

choice.text: Killing Gos was probably not the right thing to do.

event.text: Ellie stares at you blankly, barely even breathing. "Who's Gos, silly?"
"Oh! Hahah! Yes. Now, let's move on."

choice.text: I'm not comfortable doing this right now.
I'm not comfortable doing this right now.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_5
event.text: You can't seem to find Ellie in any of her usual spots. Instead, you eventually find her crawled up in the airlock, with the safety features disabled. She looks distraught, but as you approach she climbs to her feet and attempts to regain her standard composure. "Are you ready superfan? We're on the last item on my list! It's gonna be great... the super awesome saucesome kind of great!"

"We're going to be going after Sammy the Spider! That stupid idiot evil monstrous fiend stole my place on the show, outsold my merchandise, and is corrupting the youth with his 'hip and trendy' fads! Rap music? Seriously?! What are they teaching the children?! We're going to get rid of this menace, and when he's out of the way, the show will be mine again! I'll be a star for all the Multiverse to see! Oh isn't it wonderful how close we are?! And when we're done, it'll be a free life's supply of quarp juice and merchandise for you superfan, for bringing me all this way!" Ellie wipes a tear away. "I dare even say... we might be friends?! But we can worry about that later, Sammy must come first!"

choice.text: I'm not comfortable doing this right now.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_COMICS
event.text: You look through your comic books. What do you want to read?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_COMIC_DEVORAK
event.text: The vibrant panels tell the enthralling tale of a Zoltan warrior named Devorak Rei, an underdog soldier stuck in the middle of the Federation-Mantis War fighting for the Ministry alongside Human and Engi companions. In the end, Devorak stands triumphant but scarred from his experiences with the Mantis. Short but sweet, and surprisingly historically accurate.

After the events of the Federation-Mantis War, Devorak is honored by the Ministry as a hero and put in charge of their peacekeeper training program. However, he is left broken after his lost brother Biene is declared dead after having been missing in action for years. This leads to a greater internal struggle when the Federation erected a memorial to Node 17, which listed only the names of the humans who lost their lives, and nothing of the Zoltan or Engi soldiers who had faught just as valiantly. The comic ends with Devorak struggling with where his allegiances will fall.

The third comic opens straight into the violent turmoil of the Free Mantis genocides, where Devorak witnesses firsthand the Federation's inaction against unjust cruelty towards his people. Finally broken, Devorak turns to a rising Duskbringer movement and begins to recruit new members through the academy at which he teaches. At the end of the comic, the Ministry discovers his secret, and he flees to the Duskbringer Stronghold to escape punishment. A bitter end to the story, but that's about as much as much of his origins as the Federation knows.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_COMIC_TULLY
event.text: You open the comic to find a fairly accurate retelling of Tully's past. Starting from his birth in the Union, Tully leads an uneventful life within a small industrial mining colony to impoverished parents. Suddenly, he is thrust into the center of the new rising galactic conflict when Mantis invaders destroy his colony and kill everyone he loves, leading to him enlisting in the Union military to fight back against the Mantis threat.

You're surprised to find in the second comic one of Tully's first accomplices is none other than Admiral Vance Wentworth himself! Already a high ranking star-commander, Vance shows Tully the ropes and soon they become fast friends. However, they are split up for some time until Tully is captured during a mission and brought to a central Mantis POW camp where Vance is already being kept. Both are tortured beyond belief but remain resilient and eventually lead a movement against their captors, escaping but not without the deaths of several dozen other prisoners.

In the third comic Tully wanders lost throughout the frozen hellscape he is trapped on, saved only just in time by a small band of Mantis scientists taking refuge after having tried to escape the Hive themselves. He meets a young mantis named Tiifleeiiik, who he becomes good friends with, and learns the native Mantis language of Yeitiiik. At the end of the comic, Vance returns to the Federation front-lines and a search party is sent out for Tully, who returns to the Federation safely. This leads to one final assault on Tiet III, the heart of the Mantis war machine, where the Hive surrenders and the Federation is delcared the victor.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_COMIC_WAR
event.text: Everyone knows the stories of the Federation-Mantis War, but these comics provide a unique point of view from that of the Leeches, who played a small but important role in the conflict. The story begins with a peaceful day on humanity's homeworlds, Earth. Suddenly, a Mantis invasion descends on the planet, but is defeated by the human forces along with the power of the Gatling gun, a revolutionary advancement in technology created by Jackson Newman and produced by Zulfiqar Armaments. Though Earth survives, humankind is shaken and ready for war.

The Mantis continue to aggress the situation, thirsting for conquest, and launch attacks against the Harmony and the Ministry. Frightened, Union Senator Adrian Novikov arranges to meet with the Harmony and Minister Lumei, and together they form a trade alliance known as the Federation. However, in the meantime, conflicts stirring within the Eargen Republic and Floral Gathering lead to the opposing force known as the Trifecta, consisting of the Hive, Eargen Republic, and the Carnivora.

Now having evolved into a full-scale galactic conflict, both sides lead constant attacks against each other. The conflict goes on for 5 years, with the Hive relying heavily on the support of its two main allies. However, the tides turn when the Vampweeds and Florals signed the treaty of Kadahellian'ek, promising to avoid conflict with each other. Furthermore, a military coup within the Republic led to the public assasination of the former leader Aerkae who had firmly supported the Hive. Without any allies left, the Hive finally surrendered after its defeat during the battle of Tiet III.

event.name: COMBAT_CHECK_PANIC
event.text: You glance cautiously at the big bright red button. Are you sure you want to push it?
Really? You really want to press the big red button?
Seriously? It's definitely not a good idea. You got it from a mysterious Slug, that doesn't bode well.
Are you sure? Like, absolutely positively sure. I'm going to be frank, it's going to end horribly. This isn't a joke. I'm being serious. It's going to kill you.

choice.text: Please, I really really really want to press it.

event.text: This is your final warning.

choice.text: BY PRESSING THIS I AM HEREBY ACCEPTING MY OWN DEATH. HEKTAR INDUSTRIES (TM) IS NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY AND ALL DEATHS CAUSED BY THE PRESSING OF THIS BUTTON.

event.text: Sirens flash as you hear a massive explosion shake your entire ship, and then all is black. The enemy ship watches as the pieces of your ship float out into the abyss, nothing left for them to even scrap. Don't say you weren't warned.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_STATUS_REAL
event.text: You are now viewing the mission report. Here you can see any secrets or special events you've encountered on this run! If a category appears empty, it means you have not found anything that goes there yet.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_STATUS_BOSS
event.text: When you kill or pacify (in the case of a special victory condition) a boss, it will appear here.

choice.text: Prophet Of the Great Eye [Free Mantis Hunting Grounds]

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_STATUS_MV
event.text: When you kill a Multiverse Renegade Cruiser, it will appear here.

CLASS: EHG Cruiser FACTION: Exotic Hunter's Guild
Constructed originally by the Kleptocracy as an early model of a light cruiser, engineers soon realized the absurd wingspan of this vessel made it both impractical to maneuver and to store in their traditionally cramped hangars. Though originally planned to be discarded entirely, the original prototype ended up in the hands of one of the earliest Guild rangers, a friend of the residing king Terlack. Taking a liking to the idea of the Guild having an appropriately extravagant cruiser model of their own, full scale production within privately owned shipyards commenced soon-there-after. This little known and only moderately interesting tale is among many of similar stories engraved on Terlack's tomb, which is so long it is believed no mortal Slug could read it within an average lifespan.

CLASS: Imperial Cruiser FACTION: Crystalline Empire
The origins of the initial design of the Imperial Cruiser have been lost to time, though some historians (or wannabe grave robers) claim they can be found sealed away inside the ancient crypt of the distant Emperor Ycathine constructed underneath Wria, the Crystalline Homeworlds. No one really believes this since the vault likely doesn't exist at all, and many people have emerged claiming to be the descendents of the original engineer responsible. This includes a couple Crystal aristocrats, one of Empress Dianesh's 20 times removed cousins, and once a very delusional Leech.

CLASS: Duskbringer Cruiser FACTION: The Duskbringers
At the start of their rise to infamy, the Duskbringers first used old science vessels stolen from the Ministry. Over time as their identity evolved and the movement gained more traction, the brightest minds of the Duskbringers gathered together and crafted a warship capable of rivaling the Ministry's strongest cruiser. Now the pride and joy of the Duskbringers, many a heated debate has started over the superiority of the vessel.

CLASS: Harmony Cruiser FACTION: The Engi Harmony
Fashioned from a living swarm of trillions of nanites, the Harmony Cruiser may look like a mound of garbage, but underneath the hood is an extremely efficient network. Many foolish marauders, especially the odd slaver, have mistakenly interpreted the ship's small size as a sign of weakness, but they couldn't be further from the truth. There's many a legend, strange as it may be, of sightings of Harmony Cruisers "mating" and producing smaller ships from the aftermath.

CLASS: Engineer Cruiser FACTION: The Rebellion
The Rebellion's Engineer Corps have gained considerable military tract, mostly a show of dominant strength. In suit, it was only fitting they be given a mighty vessel capable of both immense military strength and utility. The wide-reaching wingspan of the Engineer Cruiser has become iconic, and the glistening paint-job of Engineer vessels is the subject of envy of many an underfunded Federation captain.

CLASS: Federation Cruiser FACTION: The Federation
The successor to the preliminary and outdated Kestrel Cruiser, the once unfinished prototype of the Federation Cruiser was recovered during the Civil War after having been stolen by the Rebels and utilized to fashion the Rebel Flagship's infamous artillery. Now in widescale production, the somewhat unfortunate shape of these ships comes secondhand in embarrassment only to the widespread dislike for the unwieldly charge times of the artillery weapons. Thanks to the prosperous wealth of Universe 0 however, newer models feature much more sophisticated technology that has allowed these cruisers to compete with other state of the art ships in the Multiverse era.

CLASS: Free Mantis Cruiser FACTION: The Free Mantis
Fashioned haphazardly out of parts of smaller Hive ships by early Free Mantis engineers, this ship is almost older than the movement itself. With the first model being created and captained by the now well known Free Mantis revolutionary Freddy, many Free Mantis have created replicas. Though each version has a few signature differences, the striking accuracy at which the Free Mantis have faithfully recreated their precious cruiser is nothing but a testament to the unstoppable capabilities of a hard determined Mantis.

CLASS: Kestrel Cruiser FACTION: The Federation
Perhaps the most iconic model still in circulation, the Kestrel was once on the way out. With fewer than a hundred models still in use at the start of the Civil War, after the hero of Universe 0 defeated the Rebel Flagship aboard their own classic Kestrel, a newfound craze took storm of the galaxy and Kestrels began widespread production once again. Almost driving the new prototype Federation cruiser project to death, the two cruisers manage to run in harmony, with the Kestrel now serving a more civilian use for middle-class Union citizens and upstart Renegades.

CLASS: Lanius Cruiser FACTION: The Swarm
The sweeping blades of the Lanius Cruiser, though once suspected to be some sort of bizzare defensive protrusion, actually appear to be some sort of ritualistic inclusion. Far from spiritual, the Lanius' unique aesthetic seems to be driven by a more natural, innate force. Always well armed, cruisers like these have become a terror for any settler who found themselves too close to the area of influence of the re-emerging Swarm during the Civil War.

CLASS: Lost Sun Cruiser FACTION: The Lost Suns
For the first several years of the Lost Sun revolution, their fleet lacked any distinct livery. Upon seeing the unifying power the rather simple but distinct paintjobs used by fellow revolutionaries like the Duskbringers and Free Mantis however, Lost Sun Admiral Ariadne jumped at the opportunity and quickly seized hold of a Theocracy shipyard. Though most Lost Sun vessels are smaller in size, a few cruisers such as these can be seen terrorizing Theocracy fleets with their immense firepower.

CLASS: Hive Cruiser FACTION: The Mantis Hive
Near the time of the Federation-Mantis War (when it was still known as the Human-Mantis War)'s beginning, the Hive only employed the use of smaller, mobile vessels for quick deployment. When the war shifted towards later conflicts between fleets thanks to the added might of the Ministry fleet, the Hive began to invest in larger warships. The dreaded Hive Cruiser keeps the maneuverability and sleek build of the original fleet but can fit a larger arsenal and supporting crew.

CLASS: Illesctrian Cruiser FACTION: The Zoltan Ministry
Though it may seem unusual for the pacifist and non-militaristic monks to carry a warship of this size, but in fact the impressive size and defensive strength of these ships has dissuaded many an otherwise marauder from harming the monks. Built after the genocidal attacks of the Infernals on Monk space, these cruisers now carry entire clergies across the galaxy to spread the words of their faith, as well as serving as sanctuaries for Ministry politicians and refugees.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_STATUS_CREW
event.text: When you recruit special crew, they will appear here.

PROFILE: Sherlock Haynes Titles: SDM (Standard Defense Militia) Detective, (Former) Multiverse Renegade Species: Human - Age: 36 - Gender: Male
Haynes was born a citizen of the Galactic Union on the infamous Antiquum Terrae. After his home was ravaged by blood thirsty, gigantic insects called the Vek, he left his past behind to seek out his dreams of becoming a detective for the Militia. He's fairly well known as a Multiverse Renegade, popping in to help various realities whenever he can. Unfortunately, he'll probably never get over his entomophobia, but his old-fashioned revolver was forged from the metal of an Alpha Scarab's shell as revenge.

PROFILE: Brodric Tully Title: Federation Admiral Species: Human - Age: 57 - Gender: Male
Tully is a man who lives up to his legend, if not more. Born to a penniless family of Union miners and orphaned by a Mantis attack, Tully has been serving in the Federation since the Federation first began. Maybe, if you survive this mission, Tully can sit you down and tell you some stories from his past. But for now, you have a Flagship ahead to prepare for and no time to lose.

PROFILE: Captain A5540L3 Title: Pirate King Species: Cognitive - Age: 8 - Gender: Male
A55 is one of the only three known cognitives in the galaxy, alongside CICA and the Harmony. Having been created by the Rebellion in an attempt to replicate CICA post-civil war, the engineers began to refer to the cognitive as A5540L3, though the AI managed to revolt and escape captivity, while keeping his title. How he became a pirate king is a bit hazy and A55 himself seems to have conflicted stories, but all that matters is he's on your side, and not the Rebellion's.

PROFILE: Jerome Wentworth Title: Rebel Officer Species: Human - Age: 23 - Gender: Male
Jerome, or "Jerry" as he prefers to be called, is the nephew to none other than Admiral Vance himself. He used to aspire to be just like his Uncle, but after an unpleasant experience with a raid against Orchid space he felt differently. Before he met you, he wasn't confident enough to stand up to Vance, but now he hopes he might be able to plead with the good side that he knows is in there and maybe put an end to this war.

PROFILE: Devorak "The Deathless" Rei Title: Duskbringer General Species: Zoltan - Age: 54 - Gender: Male
Devorak was once a devoted Zoltan Peacekeeper, but when he started to see cracks in the Ministry, he eventually jumped sides to the Duskbringers. Now that he's on your side, you've learned he never really liked either. The mysterious leaders of the Duskbringer movement tended to use him as an errand runner, rather than as the noble soldier who people assumed was associated with his title. With his glory days in both the Ministry and Duskbringers over, he figures it's high time he switches to the Federation for once.

PROFILE: T-RZ1L (Turzil) Title: (Former) Chief Defender of the Harmony Species: Engi - Age: 65 - Gender: N/A
Turzil was once the proud* General of the Engi Brigade, the Harmony's finest defenders. That is, until Universe 0 Turzil was caught breaking the non-aggression pact between the Harmony and the Rebellion, and sentenced to death alongside his entire squadron. The Harmonies, united across the Multiverse, declared Turzil an interdimensional fugitive. The bounty for him is so high he still isn't certain you won't turn him in. If he can prove himself a hero in this reality as well, maybe the Federation will grant him safety from the Harmony. (*This is a figure of speech. Engi cannot feel pride.)

PROFILE: Alkali Mardovar Title: Chief Science Officer of the Geniocracy Species: Shell - Age: 51 - Gender: Male
Professor Alkali, head of the Geniocracy science district, is not your friend. He is nobody's friend. An arrogant man and proud atheist, Alkali has a spiteful view on not only those outside of the Geniocracy but those inside the Geniocracy. Frankly, he'd much prefer he be left alone with his experiments. But now that his latest experiments have been foiled by the Rebellion and Nerva's sabotage, he's deadset on getting revenge. You're just his vessel for that. Or at least, so he claims.

PROFILE: OOJ MAJOO Title: Big blob thing Species: Morph - Age: N/A - Gender: N/A
Every Morph you've ever seen has all been but a piece of OOJ. In a sense, they are all him. Yet, they act individually. The large grey blob whom the "true" OOJ gave to you is nothing but another, larger fragment of his eternally growing and dividing colony of Morphs. You might not know what he's saying, but fortunately he can understand you and clearly has the best of intentions.

PROFILE: Gregory Nights Title: (Former) King of the Kleptocracy Species: Slug - Age: 48 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
The fact this drugged and drunk loser is king might be surprising, but he wasn't always this way. Always an asshole, yes, but Nights was once a revered pirate captain comparable to other famous names like Tuco or Kazaaakplethkilik. Being the son of two devout reformists, Nights always took a political tone to his work as a bounty hunter. Having become a cultural icon within the Kleptocracy during a time when Slocknog's expansion wars were growing even more unpopular, Nights took it upon himself to seize the crown. And yes, his real first name is Gregory.

PROFILE: Slocknog Dssilli Title: (Former) King of the Kleptocracy Species: Slug - Age: 48 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
Slocknog was once the king of the Kleptocracy not long ago, but he was also the one responsible for the infamous Slug Expansion Wars. These conflicts were greatly unpopular among the Slug people, which led to his eventual overthrowal in favor of Nights. Slocknog is adamantly against the Coalition, but also against the ideologies of Reformism that have led to such heavy human influence on Slug culture. If he had his way, the Slugs would remain their own entirely independent entity, and he's not afraid to make that known to anyone who'll listen.

PROFILE: Irwin Silza Titles: Multiverse Renegade, (Former) Exotic Hunters Guild Chairman Species: Slug - Age: 44 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
Irwin is one of the most famous Clansmen Rangers since the EHG was first formed. As a young child, he dreamed of being a Multiverse Renegade, but the Federation was too protective over this technology to let anybody, especially a Slug, get their hands (or tentacles) on it. The EHG looked like the only option to get a taste of adventure, and so his travels as a Clansman began. Apparently at some point he even was their chairman, but through circumstances he refuses to talk about, he was exiled.

PROFILE: Alkram Tripae Title: (Former) General of the Eargen Republic Species: Leech - Age: 56 - Gender: Male
Alkram was once the general of the Eargen Republic's military forces during the Federation-Mantis War under leadership of Aerkae. After his assasination and the Eargen Republic's distancing from the Hive, Alkram retired from the military and for several years watched as his people were flung into further turmoil until the appointment of Tyrdeo. Highly skeptical of Tyrdeo's motives, Alkram eventually decided it was time to take action and seize control of the Republic. He failed, as you already know, but he doesn't seem too bothered by it anymore.

PROFILE: Tyrdeo Poeka Title: (Former) President of the Eargen Republic Species: Leech - Age: 31 - Gender: Male
Apparently, Tyrdeo never wanted to be president of the Republic. Sort of. He was once a gardener for the wealthier Leech aristocrats and from them he gained many eccentric dreams of power. Seeing the opportunity, Tyrdeo began to parade himself as the best choice as Aerkae's replacement. This, for some reason, worked, and he was put in charge while failing to understand what his job as president was. He's an idiot, a coward, and very self-absorbed, but he's also strangely quite endearing and eager to prove himself.

PROFILE: Tiifleeiiik 'Freddy' Kitetiiikiplik Title: Free Mantis Founder Species: Mantis - Age: 65 - Gender: Male
Freddy is very reluctant to talk about his sensitive past, but you've managed to gather this much from him; he was once an engineer for the Hive attempting to flee from the industrial coreworlds of Tiet III along with various other Mantis scientists - the first Free Mantis. At some point Freddy met a human companion, an escapee from a nearby Mantis POW camp. From this man he earned his name and his excellent understanding of the human dialect. Freddy refused to use the synthetic pheromones that his fellow Free Mantis are known for, but understands that without the concoction his people would not last for very long.

PROFILE: Kazaaakplethkilik Tiiikazpakaziiika Titles: Honorary Suzerain, Pirate Species: Mantis - Age: 72 - Gender: Male
This Mantis pirate has more to his name than just his extensive count collection of letters. He is queen Leikonpliiinakra's chosen suitor. This relationship seems to be considered taboo by his people and many see him as a traitor after rumors of him acting as an informant for the Federation during the Fed-Mantis war got out. Now, he's spent his days campaigning against the Hive's involvement in the Coalition. Maybe there's more to this warrior than meets the eye?

PROFILE: Empress Dianesh Kryel Title: Empress of the Crystalline Empire Species: Crystal - Age: 378 - Gender: Female
The Empress is older than the Federation itself, and has lived through the collapse of the Rock-Crystal Empire as well as the Federation Civil War. Through all of this it seems she has taken away one key thing - her people are rarely influenced positively by the skirmishes of foreign species. Being a skilled warrior herself, she has pledged her abilities to you to give your people a final chance. Try to impress her, or else the Crystalline-kind's stay in the new open Multiverse might be a very short one.

PROFILE: Sir Ruwen Argote Title: Foreign Ambassador of the Crystalline Empire Species: Crystal - Age: ??? - Gender: Male
Ruwen is the official Ambassador of the Crystalline Empire towards the outside world. Chosen for this position because of his unique role aboard the vessel that defeated the original Flagship, Ruwen has had a taste of both sides. Make no mistake, Ruwen's loyalty will always fall first on that of the Empire, but he is far from sharing the same xenophobic views as many other Crystals.

PROFILE: Ariadne Obadann Title: Admiral of the Lost Suns Species: Rockman - Age: 27 - Gender: Female
Ariadne is quite young to be the leader of such an aggressive resistance movement, but her past is nothing but tragic. Since she was only 3, she was arranged into marriage with none other than the Head Elder Toarde by her own father to bestow even greater power on their family. Ariadne never married Toarde as she managed to escape with help of her much older brother, a former Crusader. Together the two formed the Lost Suns, but after a fallout because of their different views over the Crystal people, her brother vanished and Ariadne took full control.

PROFILE: Rowbad 'Tuco' Eterrio Title: Dread Pirate, Private Bodyguard Species: Rockman - Age: 42 - Gender: Male
Once named Rowbad long ago, the now infamous Tuco carries the title of an ancient Rock renegade during the days of the Rock-Crystal Empire. He's been on many adventures and is considered a hero by the Rock outcasts, but his glory days are long behind him. After being spoiled by the high-life as smuggler-king Ocym's private bodyguard, he spends most of his free time drunk aboard the Sky-Drifter Casino.

PROFILE: The Beacon Eater Title: Lanius King Species: Lanius - Age: ??? - Gender: N/A
The Beacon Eater has been the king of the Lanius for millenia. His body is covered in a thick cover of rust, and it's a miracle nothing has killed him over the three separate hibernations he's endured. Apparently, his swarm isn't the only one around, but he won't indulge further information.

PROFILE: The Anointed Title: Augmented Queen Species: Lanius (Augmented) - Age: ??? - Gender: Female
The Anointed was the first of the Augmented to split away from the Swarm. When she discovered the abundant food source in the recovery sites, she guided many fellow Lanius to this new oasis, so that they might avoid the long, dreadful hibernation that their species is often forced to go through. Her sudden change of heart seems to be attributed to her sense of mystery - she wants to figure this all out as much as you.

PROFILE: Dessius Yan Tartodicus Title: Prime Reaper of the Spectral Dynasty Species: Phantom Alpha - Age: 784 - Gender: N/A
Dessius is the 16th prime Reaper, and he's been around for a long time. So long, that he can remember a time before the Federation. Truth is, he knows there's more to the Auto-threat than that they're just 'demons', but he can't let his people know without mass panic. He's put his faith in your knowledge on CICA and the Flagship, and if your intel is right, you might finally be able to make peace between the Dynasty and Federation at long last.

PROFILE: ??? Title: Giant Alien Spider Queen Species: Giant Alien Spider - Age: 24 - Gender: Female
The Queen, while not the only way for the spiders to reproduce, produces the bulk of the future spider offspring through laying eggs in massive underground hatcheries, or in storage cabinets on your ship. You expected this massive, untamed beast to cause more problems aboard your ship, but she mostly sleeps or playfully romps around the ship, when she isn't busy devouring your enemies alive that is.

PROFILE: Obyn Arokem Title: Multiverse Renegade Species: Saltman - Age: 50 - Gender: Male
Obyn is, as far as he knows, the last of his kind. After seeing his family massacred by the EHG, he's sworn to hunt down and kill every last Clansman involved. In the meantime though, he makes a pretty penny as a bounty hunter. He has a long and complicated past with Sylvan from what you understand, but he doesn't talk about it much. It seems personal, so it's better not to ask too much.

PROFILE: Rig Title: Zulfiqar Chief Marketing Officer Species: Rockman - Age: 65 - Gender: Male
Rig is a pretty important executive at Zulfiqar, so hopefully they don't mind what you've done to him. He seems to be in constant misery and always throwing up in the ship's toilet, much to the dismay of Tintan. Still, he refuses to seek help because of his stubborn determination to prove his perseverance... and also probably because he's absolutely terrified of surgery.

PROFILE: Tintan Title: Ministry Envoy Species: Zoltan - Age: 53 - Gender: Female
Tintan is nothing but your ordinary Ministry representative - or at least she would be if it wasn't for the fact she's now stuck inside of Rig. Only Rig can hear what she says and the two are frequently arguing, but it's hard to say how much of that is because of their situation and how much is because they just can't agree with each other. Not that Tintan has much of a choice.

PROFILE: Tony Senior Jr. Title: Founder and CEO of Tony's Species: Leech - Age: 40 - Gender: Male
This overweight and depressed Leech is the owner of perhaps the best known galactic retail chain in the galaxy, known simply as "Tony's". 7 years ago Tony was a happy and fit man, but now he's nothing but a mess. Considering in those 7 years he also got so rich it's hard to say what happened, and for some reason Tony doesn't want to talk about it.

PROFILE: Grand Priest Lord Vortigon Obadann XIV, Devout Follower and Leader of the Followers of the Eternal Ember and Keeper of the Holy Texts Title: Grand Priest and Devout Follower and Leader of the Followers of the Eternal Ember and Keeper of the Holy Texts Species: Rockman (Augmented) - Age: 38 - Gender: Male
Vortigon is... an interesting fellow. He took the words of the Elders to heart, and he believes in more than any other of the power of the Crystals. However, he wasn't a fan of the Elders themselves, so he, along with a band of several other Rockmen, set out to find the Crystalline Origins themselves. Somewhere along the way he went absolutely mad from overdosing on Crystalline stimulants, and you aren't sure why he's sticking with you. Maybe he's just so desperate for a friend he's willing to give anyone, even a Federation captain who almost killed him, a chance.

PROFILE: Billy Hektar Title: CEO of Hektar Industries Species: Slug - Age: 49 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
Billy has done a lot of awful things, including slavery. Despite this, he can't be blamed entirely for them when he was held at gunpoint from one of the galaxy's most dangerous men. He also genuinely seems to regret his actions, especially concerning his long lost twin brother who used to run the company alongside him. Billy expects this mission to finally turn his life around, but maybe it's best not to tell him the Federation has no control over Kleptocracy tax collection.

PROFILE: Sylvan Title: Traveling Merchant Species: Slug - Age: 49 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
Basically nothing about Sylvan's past is clear, but it's hard to deny that he's always been your most loyal ally. You aren't certain what makes him like you so much, and sometimes it's even unnerving the lengths he'll go to help you, but it's good to have someone stand by you in the face of such adversities.

PROFILE: Aenwithe Title: Obelisk Revolutionary, (Former) Cognitive Engineer Species: Obelisk - Age: Roughly 80000 - Gender: N/A (culturally male)
Aenwithe is a friendly (if not somewhat narcissistic), well spoken (if not overly talkative), and most certainly well traveled Obelisk. He was once an engineer working on the Harmony project until he defected after what he refers to as the "Prometheus Incident." Now, he's determined to make true the ancient myths of the Paragon and destroy the Multiverse to ensure the security of civilization.

PROFILE: Laiiikarkapi Karzka Title: Mantis Bishop Species: Mantis - Age: 36 - Gender: Female
The first female Bishop, Queen Leikonpliiinakra appointed Laiiikarkapi as protector of the prized royal Hatchery. However, her loyalty to the eggs far outgrew her loyalty to the queen. So much so, that she was willing to betray her monarch to save the future offspring from the horrible life of a ruthless warrior that she wishes herself to never have endured. Strangely cuddly and kind-hearted for a Mantis, no less.

PROFILE: Guntput Title: Tribal Warrior Species: Furry One Eyed Tree Lizard Thing - Age: 63 - Gender: Male
When the Hektar vessels first arrived on the lizard homeworlds, many of the lizards were amazed by their wonderous technology. No one listened to Guntput's warnings, no thanks to Metyunt, a prominent friend of the tribe's chieftain, who sided with Hektar since the beginning. When the lizards began to be shipped away to work in the Mega-Market only then did the Lizards realize the truth to Guntput's words. Now, the last few remaining lizards see modern technology as an all encompassing evil, but Guntput trusts you just enough to give you a chance.

PROFILE: Metyunt Title: Hektar Manager Species: Furry One Eyed Tree Lizard Thing - Age: 29 - Gender: Male
Metyunt is a traitor to his people and a coward at that. When the Hektar ships first arrived on his home planet, he was quick to strike a deal with Hektar in return for his own liberty. However, it's clearly taken a toll on him, and now he's desperate to find a way to repay for his crimes.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_STATUS_LOOT
event.text: When you raid (crew kill) a special loot transport, the sector you found them in will appear here.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_REAL
event.text: You look around for one of your crew to talk to.

choice.text: Mount Jerry on your tamed Equinoid.

event.text: Jerry climbs onto the horse...

choice.text: Mount Jerry on your crystal Equinoid.

event.text: Jerry climbs onto the horse...
Jerry gets off of his horse...

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_JERRY
event.text: What do you want to do with Jerry?

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_JERRY
textList.text: Jerry tells you that he genuinely respects you. That probably sounds really cheesy, but he doesn't care.
Jerry is busy dancing in his room. He invites you to join him, but you have other things to do.
Jerry is teaching the other crew how to build a card tower. Unfortunately there weren't any cards on the ship, so they're using their imagination.
Jerry is practicing his aim with his pillow. So far he hasn't hit a single shot, which is probably a good thing if he wants to sleep tonight.
Jerry isn't a devout pacifist, but he doesn't usually like to get involved in combat.
Jerry wishes the ship audio library had a larger database of music. Or any music at all, really.
Jerry hopes people still stop asking him to be the best man at their weddings. He can only attend so many before he goes insane.
Jerry says his mother always said he looked good in a uniform. He just hopes she wouldn't be disappointed in him now, standing here in a Rebel outfit.
Jerry likes his uncle, but he just wished he wasn't such a genocidal murderer.
Jerry feels, deep down, that he exists only because some guy made a dumb joke in a suggestion channel that went too far. Wayyyy too far.
Jerry wants a pet spider. Well not really, but he thinks it might be cool.
Jerry wonders how the Jerome Protectorate will be while he's away. He also really wants to change that name to something less stupid.
Jerry confirms that his full name is Jerome Wentworth. Surprisingly, that doesn't feel like a reference to something for once.
Jerry doesn't understand why his uncle hates non-humans so much. Jerry is friends with a couple aliens, and all of them were cool. Except for that one Mantis that always tried to eat his arms...

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_DETECTIVE
event.text: What do you want to do with Haynes?

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_DETECTIVE
textList.text: Haynes promises his name's resemblance to another, famous Old Earth detective is purely a coincidence.
Before becoming a Multiverse Renegade himself, Haynes used to live on Earth. However, he had to leave his home behind when Archive Inc. could no longer hold back the Vek threat.
Haynes is polishing his prized revolver. He claims to have had the thing since a child, and takes it with him anywhere he goes.

Haynes has worked up quite the reputation with the Militia, but has never considered joining their ranks. The life of a soldier doesn't fit him quite as well as "reality-hopping vigilante and detective" does. Nor does it sound nearly as cool.
Haynes wonders what will happen with Amy and Daniel now that two of their former co-workers turned out to be Rebel spies.
Haynes despises the Rebellion. There's nothing worse in Haynes's mind than a tyrant flying the flag of a supposed hero.
Haynes offers to someday teach you how to fire a gun as fast as him, but you aren't too hopeful you'll ever be as good as him.
Haynes finds, on principle, the smaller the gun, the more efficient it is in ship-board combat.

Haynes claims Slugs really aren't as tricky as they claim to be. Just in case though, he always wears a layer of tinfoil inside his hat to counteract their telepathic abilities. You aren't sure why no one else has tried this if it really works that well.
Haynes thinks the outfit makes the man. Unfortunately, it's kind of hard to tell what people are wearing at this scale.
Haynes isn't quite sure why people usually refer to him by his last name when his first is much more recognizeable.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_TURZIL
event.text: What do you want to do with Turzil?

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_TURZIL
textList.text: You find Turzil's room full of half-painted canvases of beautiful scenery. The Engi spots you looking at them and pushes you out of the room and shuts the door. Seems Turzil still struggles with expression even after separating from the Harmony.
You find Turzil walking around the ship missing his left arm. He explains that it is "behaving poorly and currently in a time out."

You find Turzil banging himself against the wall repeatedly. You try to help him, but he stops you. "Do not [worry]. I am simply -applying- percusive maintenance. I was [informed] it is effective by human engineers."

Turzil is absolutely terrified of the concept of having emotions, but is extremely glad he is, like all Engis, completely incapable of feeling strongly about anything. This has all left you very confused.
It seems Turzil has stuck a number of yellow sheets of paper onto the walls of his room. You ask about it, and he just complains about the lack of paint aboard the ship.

Turzil misses Tully quite a bit. The last time the two saw each other was several decades ago during the Last Stand at Node 17. You ask if it's usual for Engi to feel such things, and he immediately tenses up and gets defensive.

Out of cursiosity, you question Turzil about Engi ships and reproduction. Turzil looks at you strangely but provides a long and boring lecture about how Engi ships are technically 'alive' and exchange matter similar to normal biological reproduction. It's honestly quite mundane, nothing like the crazy tales you frequently hear other Renegades sharing.

You ask Turzil why he and other Separatists have different colors from normal Engis. Turzil explains that the concept of dyeing your nanites different colors to distinguish yourself has been a long lasting Separatist tradition. What Turzil doesn't explain however is why he has chosen to paint himself blue and yellow.

You find Turzil staring out one of the ship's rear windows, watching a comet fly past. "Curious. I have heard [stories] that many creatures... place... -wishes-? Yes, wishes, upon these frozen bodies of ice and dust. I have tried doing the [same]. Will it come true? I hope so..."
Turzil is pacing around one of the exterior doors to the cargo bay. When he spots you watching him, he stops and returns back to the ship, giving you a suspicious look that you match.

You go to question Turzil about why you've found a number of strange geometric scribbles lodged in various parts of the ship, but he is nowhere to be found. Strangely, whenever you go to ask him a question like this, he always disappears.

You find Turzil playing around with several electrical wires. You warn him not to screw with the ship, but it's too late. The ship goes black and Turzil vibrates with an electric shock. For a few moments, you swear the shield of the entire ship turns yellow, but after a few seconds it goes back to the normal blue, and the lights come back on.

Turzil worries sometimes about his maniac habits. It's not unusual for Separatists to exhibit strange characteristics after liberation, but Turzil cannot help but constantly obsess over the color yellow and paint. He hopes he is not going insane. Or becoming an artist.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_DEVORAK
event.text: What do you want to do with Devorak?

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_DEVORAK
textList.text: You find Devorak sitting with several of the other crew, reciting tales of his war efforts. Though a majority of them are against the Federation, it's still quite entertaining.
Devorak thinks just about any situation can be solved by killing yourself and cloning afterwards. You don't think that's generally good advice.
Devorak warns that if you ever convert him into a mobile power source only, he'll kill you and throw your corpse out the airlock, then steal the ship and leave.
Devorak sometimes wishes he could go back to when he could feel things, rather than getting shot on the chest and figuring out about it an hour later.
Devorak remembers a time when he was once afraid to explode in battle. Now, it's nothing but second nature to him.
Devorak apologizes for your lack of ability to implode at will, and hopes seeing him do it doesn't cause you too much envy.
Devorak thinks all Rebels can go to hell. If siding with the Federation is what it takes for that dream to come true, and so it seems to be, then let it be so.
Devorak regrets ever having made a truce with the Rebellion. Now, he looks back at that decision wondering how he ever fell for such a stupid trick.
Devorak understands the need for crew damaging weapons, but finds it cowardly unless the killing strike is made by actual crew.
Devorak seems to have no end of war stories to share at a moment's notice.

Devorak recalls back to when he was a Peacekeeper at the Ministry. It wasn't the most glamorous job, but he does miss getting paid to kick people in the teeth. He still does, but it's for a non-profit cause.
Devorak scoffs at the Federation database entries about him, pointing out several flaws and large chunks of missing information that he would have assumed to be "obvious".
Devorak is willing to sacrifice himself in battle for the greater good, but would obviously prefer that a Clone Bay be backing him up when he does.

Devorak retells the time when a battle got so dire he suicide bombed his entire ship into a Federation Carrier, saving his entire fleet. It was only by a miracle that the portion of the ship with the Clone Bay was not too destroyed, and he was able to repeatedly clone until he was picked up once again.
Devorak tells a war story of when he once took out an entire ship of Peacekeepers in a single explosion after weakening them all with bombs.
Devorak shares a story about one time when he killed an entire Slug aquatic unit by jumping into the lake they were in and electrocuting all of them.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_KAZ
event.text: What do you want to do with Kazaaakplethkilik?

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_KAZ
textList.text: "My people have forgotten codes of honor we once held so dear. In old days we live independent lives, proud lives! Now we resign selves to hunting in crowded ships of thieves, religious freaks, and suicidal tapeworms! What tragedy is this?!"

Kaz mentions the most frequent resistance he receives is that his views are simply outdated. "Who is to saying all ideas are bad because they are old? Not all change good change. And what is meaning of 'boomer mentality'?"

With Kaz busy eating in the cafeteria, you take a quick look around his room. In a small box in the corner of the room you find some... compromising pictures of the Mantis queen. You jump when you hear the door open and Kaz enter the room. "You looking at Kaz things? Oh, heheh. There are more of those if you are wanting look at them, captain."

You're curious about the stories of Kaz being an informant for the Federation during the old war. "It no secret I feel great pride for Hive, but during days of Federation-Mantis War we lose direction. I am hunter and thief captain, not soldier. Any step to end war in peaceful resolution necessary."
You find Kaz using his sword to saw off the arm of one of the dead boarders you've yet to vent from the cargo bay. You admonish him, but he does a rude dance and wiggles his sword at you.

You wonder why Kaz wields specialized swords when his claws are effectively melee weapons of their own. "Captain, have you never hearing of 'rule of cool?' Bigger sword better than claw and looking much more badass!"

Kaz claims the red paint all over his cruiser is actually blood. Nothing about that claim seems believable, but Kaz also seems like the kind of person to go to that length. Even if he wasn't - you wouldn't want to be the one to tell him you don't believe it.

Kaz tries to help you remember and pronounce his full name. "Remembering this, it is Kazaaakplethkilik. Kaz - aaak - pleth- kilik. Thinking of triple A as screams of damned as I slice throats, with k as sound of bodies hitting floor. This is part most are tripping up on. Kilik easy as well. I am killing icky things. 'Kill ick.' 'kilik.'"
Kaz prods you in the stomach. "Heh, so squishy. What it like to not have carapace? Could cut you open like water filled balloon with swipe of hand! Heheh. Not that I will. But I could."

You wonder why Kaz is known first as a thief. "Oh, I am stealing many of things. Stealing kidneys, stealing lives, stealing virginities! I am greatest of thieves!" You don't think Kaz understands what being a thief means, but at least he's proud.

It seems your autopilot is on the fritz. You tinker with the settings but it can't seem to calculate the next jump properly. You're about to give up when Kaz enters the room, fiddles with the device, punches in some numbers, and walks away. The computer beeps and corrects your route. Seems Kaz really might be smarter than your average Mantis.

Kaz complains about the Hive's use of pheromones. "We are ridiculing Free Mantis for unnatural concoctions but Hive has been doing same thing for years. Substances are less potent, yes, but addiction is still crippling. I am losing many friends to it."

"You are hopefully understanding when Rebellion defeated, Kaz must go back to hunting. If we are meeting each other again though, don't thinking I will go easy on you! I always doing better in the rematch. Heheh."

Though most of the crew are attempting to catch some sleep while they can, it seems Kaz is still wandering the ship. "Sleeping is for time when you get stabbed in back! Kaz will taking no chances, not even in this company. Fortunately, my kind can sleeping with only half of brain. This is why Kaz so dopey sometimes. Am always half asleep."

Kaz attempts to grab a plate from the dining room but drops it onto the floor. "Damn it! Stupid claws good for nothing but slicing. Engi slaves immoral my ass. More immoral leaving Mantis people suffering trying to picking damn things up!"

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_TUCO
event.text: What do you want to do with Tuco?

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_TUCO
textList.text: You find Tuco's nailed a picture of an Aquarian to his wall, where he's begun to use it as target practice. "That's my dumbass boss, Ocym. For the founder of Argeonn he's barely functional. If it wasn't for that serpent Tiesum he keeps around, the clan would have already collapsed. Supposedly there was another founder at some point, but no one knows what happened to him."

You do a once over of the cargo bay and find a hidden stash of booze stuffed in one of the vents. The question in your mind isn't who's responsible, but rather how Tuco keeps managing to sneak this aboard.

"The Theocracy banned gambling because people were wasting all of their money in casinos rather than in the church. I'd be damned if I had to give one more undeserved cent to those robed, preaching megalomaniacs when I could be playing slots and having a good time."

You're surprised to see Tuco still has a small blue shard around a necklace hanging in his room. These are traditionally religious symbols for Chrysolism, but Tuco explains it was a gift from his grandmother. "That old bat was cuckoo but she hated the Elders so much, even the Lost Suns would have been terrified of her. Incredible woman. I'm honored to carry anything of hers."
You warn Tuco about drinking so much. Having a hangover while in the middle of combat tends not to go over so well. Yet, the Rockman refuses. He'd rather die drunk than have to face reality.

You find Tuco asleep at his station. You try to wake him but he doesn't budge. You're about to diagnose him as dead when he startles awake, swatting you so hard you collide with the wall, and screaming bloody murder about 'rodents of unusual size'.

Whenever Tuco isn't having an alcoholic episode, he likes to pass time by telling the crew stories of former pirates who share his title. Sometimes it gets awfully confusing, trying to remember the difference between the several dozen Tucos whose stories he moves through seamlessly.
Tuco misses his days living within the Badlands. Though the outcasts don't mingle with outsiders much, there's tremendous cooperation within the various clans, both nomadic and settled.
"I still can hardly believe those bastards kicked me out of Sky-Drifter. You have one drunken rampage and suddenly you aren't allowed on the premises! Pansies."
You find Tuco trying on different outfits, trying to find one that's more threatening. It seems he's kind of lost focus though, because currently he's wearing a dress and tiara.

"Hahah. You wanna know something funny? Now, I learned this during my stay in the Badlands. Elder Stonewall, one of the most feared men in all the Theocracy, is really named Kaora! HAHAHAHAHAH!" You aren't really sure what's so funny about that name, but Tuco is laughing so hard he can barely stand.

You ask Tuco why he's chosen to paint himself yellow unlike the pink of normal Outcasts. "What? What kind of stupid question is what? I do it because I like yellow. Did you really expect something deeper?"

Tuco laments the day the Paladins descended on the Vrachos IV protestors. Not because of the tragic death of hundreds, or because of his own arrest, but because he should have punched those assholes in the face rather than let himself be exiled.

Tuco's never once considered working with the Lost Suns. "I don't believe Ariadne has malicious intent, but I don't think her vision is practical either. Too many people are vying for control of the Theocracy, the vision of an independent democracy is anything but secure. Whatever happens, I'm never going back. I have all the booze I want and NOBODY is going to take it away from me."
Tuco tries to teach your crew how to play the classic Rock gambling and drinking game. This isn't going to over well tomorrow, but there's no point arguing with Tuco when he's drunk.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_ARIADNE
event.text: What do you want to do with Ariadne?

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_ARIADNE
textList.text: "Funny, whenever the Elders come into question, it's always Stonewall or Toarde. What of the other three? Murvara runs the incredibly cruel prison systems, Rutha is responsible for all the worst propaganda employed by the Theocracy, and Pretore... uh... I actually don't really know what Pretore does. I think he's in charge of waste management?"

You question Ariadne why all of the Lost Suns wear hats. "Clothing in Rock culture is traditionally a symbol of wealth, manufacturing apparel that can cover our bulk is expensive. Our hats are a symbol of defiance to this - while not so elaborate that we could be mistaken as priests."

You find a torn piece of cloth in Ariadne's room, singed at the corners and clearly torn off of a larger piece of apparel. "That was a part of my wedding dress, for when I was meant to be Toarde's bride. In commemoration of the occasion, I tore it to pieces and set it on fire. This is all that's left. I keep it around in case of some dire emergency where I forget how much I hate the Elders."

You ask Ariadne if arranged marriages are frequent in the Theocracy. "Only amongst priests and royalty. In such families, individuality matters less than dirt. If you're male, you get sent off to be a Crusader, like my brother. If you're female, you get forced into marriage. That isn't to say the poor are free either. The church has to approve before marriage can become official."

Ariadne's quarters are decorated by a number of trophies, various ornaments, weapons, and robes. The faint red splashes of dried bloodstains and what appears to be battle damage suggests these items all once belonged to different people. It doesn't take a genius to guess what happened to them, though.

For a revolutionary leader, Ariadne doesn't seem terribly talkative about the Lost Suns. Sure, she frequently takes every chance she can to talk trash about the Elders, but according to her the Lost Suns aren't "something worth bragging over". She claims they aren't a movement - they're the manifestation of the natural rights that which they have all been robbed. You suspect she just doesn't like being called a Rebel in this climate. Who would?

You find Ariadne busy in her room, pacing in front of a massive star-map that covers most of the floor. Several pieces, random assortments of objects from around the ship, have been placed like chess tokens, and holographic annotations have been hastily scribbled everywhere. Seems, even aboard your ship, her constant obsessive planning never ceases.

You notice Ariadne rarely ever eats with the rest of the crew, instead taking very small portions, just enough to maintain her current body weight. Along with that, she never accepts gifts from other crew members, never asks to borrow anything, and always leaves her stations in the same condition as she found them. Either she has some more issues than she's letting on, or just feels immense guilt for her past life as a princess. Or, probably both.

"Some say the Lost Suns are a cult. Ironic, considering we fight so hard against poisonous spiritual beliefs. If we were a cult, we'd sacrifice those who insult us in some kind of ritual. But we aren't, so I usually settle for burning them alive. No need to be eccentric."

Sometimes Ariadne can be... very extreme, but you have to admire the purpose of her mission and her dedication towards it. Though, you'll probably have to work with her on all of those public executions. The Federation would be more graceful if she wasn't going genocidal against the clergy.

Ariadne laments the way in which Chrysolism has spread to other species like the Orchids and Leeches. "It's incredible, a doctrine originally meant only to manipulate the Rock people, has been adopted by countless millions of innocent lives outside of the Theocracy. The Theocracy's influence is immense, and has disastrous consequences. I'm not even sure how to begin reversing all of the damage the Inquisitions have done."
Ariadne shares the story of how she once met the infamous Dread Pirate Tuco.

Ariadne doesn't speak much of her brother. Once a Crusader, he helped her escape from Toarde on the eve of her wedding. They founded the Lost Suns together, but he held true to his beliefs in Crystalline Divinity. This conflict eventually led to a schism in the movement, and after that she never saw her brother again.

You find Ariadne has started a 'small' fire in the cargo bay, where she has taken a seat and is watching the flames. You try to tell her to put it out, but she swats you away. "It's under control. There's always comfort in flames. Besides, what's the worst that can happen? We burn down half the cargo bay? Actually, now that I say it, that is pretty bad."

You ask Ariadne what her obsession is with fire. "Fire is a fact of nature, an unstoppable force that can cleanse anything if given enough to prosper. And everything it does touch, it starts anew. Hopefully I don't need to dumb down the metaphor further."

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_VORTIGON
event.text: What do you want to do with Vortigon?

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_VORTIGON
textList.text: As you approach Vortigon, he begins to laugh menacingly. Uncertain, you back slowly out of the room and close the door behind you.
Vortigon is busy contemplating if he should change the color of his robes.
Vortigon brags about how cool his name is, and insults your 'pathetic' name. According to him, the name's length is what matters most.
Vortigon hopes that the crew of other Federation ships have more style and class than yours.
Vortigon appears to be under-way with some sort of strange ritual. As long as he isn't summoning any demons, you're ok with it.
Vortigon wonders what other lifeforms he might be able to convert into his cult now that he has left the Crystalline Homeworlds.
Vortigon makes it clear time and time again that he finds you disgusting. Why did we let this guy onto the ship?
Vortigon is busy cooking some sort of strange stew made with the blood of virgins.
Vortigon briefly mentions something about a rival cult, whose name sounds something similar to 'Mar', whose been stealing their recruits for some time. He doesn't sound very happy about it.
Vortigon never wants to see another damn teal ship ever again. Something about some 'Elder Cult', but he won't say anything more.
Vortigon hates being slow. He also hates tripping over his cloak. Come to think of it, he seems to hate a lot of things.
Vortigon wants to meet the Zoltan Minister some day. He thinks the Zoltan race would make an excellent addition to his cult.
Vortigon is busy writing another chapter for the Ember Holy Texts.
